title.narrative: IUCN Naturbaserade lösningar för resilienta samhällen
IUCN Nature-based Solutions for Resilient Communities in the Western Balkans

description.narrative:
Den regionala insatsen ADAPT: Nature-based Solutions for Resilient Societies in the Western Balkans kommer att genomföras i Albanien, Kosovo, Bosnien och Hercegovina, Nord Makedonien, Montenegro och Serbien. Projektet syftar till att visa hur naturbaserade lösningar kan komplettera tekniska lösningar i arbetet med klimatanpassning och katastrofriskreducering. Projektet är ett pilotprojekt för att implementera naturbaserade lösningar i Albanien och Serbien, sprida kunskap om naturbaserade lösningar bland allmänhet och beslutsfattare i regionen.
Projektet fokuserar på områden utsatta för effekter av klimatförändringar som tex översvämningar och kommer därmed att bidra till arbetet med katastrofriskreducering, klimatanpassning, biologisk mångfald och miljöhänsyn. Indirekt kommer projektet genom ett väl integrerat jämställdhetsperspektiv och rättighetsperspektiv bidra till att visa hur miljöhänsyn kan skapa förutsättningar för ökad jämställdhet och demokratisering. Avsikten är också att denna insats utgör en start till ett större projekt att ansöka från gröna klimatfonden.

The ADAPT: Nature-based Solutions for Resilient Societies in the Western Balkan project aims to demonstrate how nature based solutions can complement engineering solutions in disaster risk reduction. The project will identify solutions on how nature can improve; water security; food security; solutions for disaster risk reduction; and solutions for climate adaptation in Western Balkan with pilots in Albania and Serbia and assessments in BiH, Montenegro, North Macedonia and Kosovo.
The project focuses on areas exposed to effects of climate change such as floods and will thus contribute to the work on disaster risk reduction, climate adaptation, biodiversity and environmental considerations. Indirectly, through a well-integrated gender equality and rights perspective, the project will help to show how environmental considerations can create conditions for increased gender equality and democratisation. It is also intended that this effort is a start to a larger project to apply from the Green Climate Fund.

Overall objective of the project: Increased ecosystem and community resilience to climate change and environmental degradation in the Western Balkans Objective 1: Enhance knowledge and awareness of nature-based disaster risk reduction solutions among decision makers, natural resource managers and local communities Objective 2: Enhance integration of Nature-based Solutions and climate-smart planning into adaptation and disaster risk reduction policy Objective 3: Increase implementation of nature-based disaster risk reduction solutions
The contribution is expected to demonstrate how nature based solutions can reduce vulnerability to natural disasters and at the same time create livelihood opportunities for people depending on ecosystem services. The work on capacity building will build awareness about nature based solutions among general public and decision makers. The implementation of concrete nature based solutions in Serbia and Albania will serve as a demonstration site for other countries in the Region.

participating-org.narrative: IUCN/International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
IUCN/International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources

tag.narrative: 11.5 - By 2030, significantly reduce the number of deaths and the number of people affected and substantially decrease the direct economic losses relative to global gross domestic product caused by disasters, including water-related disasters, with a focus on protecting the poor and people in vulnerable situations.

11.5 - Till 2030 väsentligt minska antalet dödsfall och antalet människor som drabbas av katastrofer, inklusive vattenrelaterade katastrofer. Även tillse att de direkta ekonomiska förlusterna till följd av sådana katastrofer, i form av lägre global BNP, minskar väsentligt. Särskilt fokus bör ligga på att skydda de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer.
13.1 - Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
13.1 - Stärka motståndskraften mot och förmågan till anpassning till klimatrelaterade faror och naturkatastrofer i alla länder.
13.2 - Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning.
13.2 - Integrera klimatåtgärder i politik, strategier och planering på nationell nivå.

13.3 - Förbättra utbildningen, medvetenheten och den mänskliga och institutionella kapaciteten vad gäller begränsning av klimatförändringarna, klimatanpassning, begränsning av klimatförändringarnas konsekvenser samt tidig varning.
13.3 - Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.

15.1 - By 2020, ensure the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of terrestrial and inland freshwater ecosystems and their services, in particular forests, wetlands, mountains and drylands, in line with obligations under international agreements.

15.1 - Till 2020 bevara, återställa och hållbart använda ekosystem på land och i sötvatten och deras ekosystemtjänster, särskilt skogar, våtmarker, berg och torra områden, i enlighet med de skyldigheter som anges i internationella överenskommelser.
15.9 - By 2020, integrate ecosystem and biodiversity values into national and local planning, development processes, poverty reduction strategies and accounts.
15.9 - Senast 2020 integrera ekosystemens och den biologiska mångfaldens värden i nationella och lokala planerings- och utvecklingsprocesser, i strategier för fattigdomsminskning samt i räkenskaper.
6.6 - By 2020, protect and restore water-related ecosystems, including mountains, forests, wetlands, rivers, aquifers and lakes.
6.6 - Senast 2020 skydda och återställa de vattenrelaterade ekosystemen, däribland berg, skogar, våtmarker, floder, akviferer och sjöar.

title.narrative: Grant agreement between Sida and IUCN - Western Balkans
Beslut om insats, IUCN reg västra Balkan

description.narrative:
The IUCN Programme Management Team (PMT) and partners have made noticeable progress with project implementation during the reporting period, despite continued challenges through the first half of 2021 caused by the Covid-19 pandemic which prevented regular work flows, face to face meetings, exchange among project partners, and field visits. Visible achievements were made in the areas of knowledge generation, policy analysis, awareness and outreach, partnership building, and pilot Nature-based Solutions field interventions. Key achievements in Year 2 include the following:
Output 1: Knowledge, awareness and capacity building Knowledge products were wrapped up, by finalizing five national NbS Scoping Studies out of six. The only study not being fully drafted at the moment is the one for Kosovo. The lack of a NbS field expert in this economy triggered delays in the finalisation of the study. This task will be externalized to a consultant and is scheduled for year 3. In addition, to the scoping studies, good NbS practices from the region continued to be collected during year 2 that will be reunited in a compendium of best practice from the region and will be displayed on online knowledge platforms i.e. PANORAMA and OPPLA. On capacity building and training, procurement was conducted in 2021 for the services of 2 trainers, one international and one national, from the Western Balkan region, that will develop training materials and that will implement six NbS trainings in the region (year 3). As a transversal objective, the continuous implementation of a comprehensive communications strategy as well as translating a number of NbS knowledge products into local languages i.e. the IUCN Global Standard for NbS into Albanian, Macedonian and Serbian along with the Restoration Opportunities Assessment Methodology were important milestones in year.
Output 2: Policy advocacy and mainstreaming The ADAPT PMT worked towards establishing a clear governance structure by fully operationalizing the Project Advisory Group and the NbS Coordination Groups. A Comparative Policy Analysis study was finalised, accompanied by a set of recommendation and an action plan for policy mainstreaming in the region. The overall objectives of the analysis were to analyse CCA, DRR and sectoral policies in each of the Western Balkan economies against NbS principles and to provide insights into policy gaps and opportunities for integrating NbS into relevant polices. On policy mainstreaming, the project team worked on integrating the NbS definition into the Law on Nature Protection and in the Decree on Methodology for preparation of risk assessments in North Macedonia. More policies and sectoral plans and/or programmes have been shortlisted and prioritised for policy mainstreaming, for example river basin management plans in Albania or National Adaptation Planning processes in Serbia, Montenegro and Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Output 3: NbS implementation and Scale-up Two NbS pilot sites were selected to implement NbS field interventions Kraljevo, Serbia and Elbasan, Albania. In Serbia, the first phase of the pilot was successfully completed and consisted of conducting a series of environmental, socio-economic and gender baseline assessments. A team of experts narrowed down the area of intervention and selected Gledike Mountain as the NbS pilot location; they equally provided a list of preliminary NbS measures for implementation on the ground. In early 2022, the NbS Serbian pilot moved into its second phase of development: technical design. In Albania, a first field visit was performed in July 2021 with the aim of meeting local representatives of Elbasan and to learn about the citys strategic development priorities and meet local stakeholders. Procurement for a team of experts that will be in charge of performing baseline assessments was launched in quarter 4 of 2022. In North Macedonia a macro-location at municipality level was also selected for future piloting activities and for the realisation of a tender dossier.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
